title: What are your tricks to discover if a politician is saying the truth? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: There are no tricks. It’s simply a matter of listening to what they say then seeing if they back it up. This sometimes takes time. A politician will say something in a hearing or on the campaign trail, only to not do what he/she said he/she would do (or not do) later on when the person thinks everyone has forgotten (or wasn’t paying attention in the first place). That along with research, fact-checking, using some common sense, and looking at statements they’ve made vs. their voting record and what they’ve done, and it’s pretty easy to figure out who’s lying. It takes time and it takes work, but you can determine who’s lying, on your own and with no “spin” doctor telling you.
I use common sense and research. Assuming that a politician is speaking truth is imprudent at best.
